labels.analysis: The MCP Server serves as a DateTime Context Provider, offering LLMs access to accurate current date and time information. It simplifies time-related operations and queries within LLM workflows by providing real-time temporal context. The core functionality revolves around providing system clock-based datetime information.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of providing time-related information aligns closely with time and date management, making the "Time & Calendar" category the most appropriate. While it could also assist in scheduling or productivity tasks, its narrow focus on datetime context makes "Time & Calendar" the best fit.

tools.name: get_current_datetime
tools.description: Get the current server date and time

server_info_crawled.name: DateTime Context Provider
server_info_crawled.author: @pinkpixel-dev/datetime-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide LLMs with the current date and time context based on the server's system clock. Enable your agents to access accurate and up-to-date temporal information seamlessly. Simplify time-related queries and operations within your LLM workflows.

tools.name: get_current_datetime
tools.description: Get the current server date and time

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@pinkpixel-dev/datetime-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
